briefdescription.para: DMA controller 1 register map base pointer.
DMA controller 2 register map base pointer.
Encodes the reason why a DMA interrupt was called.

memberdef.argsstring: (dma_dev *dev, dma_channel channel, __io void *peripheral_address, dma_xfer_size peripheral_size, __io void *memory_address, dma_xfer_size memory_size, uint32 mode)
memberdef.name: dma_setup_transfer

detaileddescription.para: The channel will be disabled before being reconfigured. The transfer will have low priority by default. You may choose another priority before the transfer begins using dma_set_priority(), as well as performing any other configuration you desire. When the channel is configured to your liking, enable it using dma_enable().

parameterdescription.para: Base address of peripheral data register involved in the transfer.
Base memory address involved in the transfer.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of data to be transferred on a DMA channel.

detaileddescription.para: You may not call this function while the channel is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Channel through which the transfer occurs.

briefdescription.para: Set the priority of a DMA transfer.

detaileddescription.para: You may not call this function while the channel is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Attach an interrupt to a DMA transfer.

detaileddescription.para: Interrupts are enabled using appropriate mode flags in dma_setup_transfer().

parameterdescription.para: Interrupt handler to call when channel interrupt fires.

briefdescription.para: Detach a DMA transfer interrupt handler.

detaileddescription.para: After calling this function, the given channel's interrupts will be disabled.

simplesect.title: Side Effects:
simplesect.para: Clears interrupt enable bits in the channel's CCR register.

briefdescription.para: Discover the reason why a DMA interrupt was called.

detaileddescription.para: You may only call this function within an attached interrupt handler for the given channel.
This function resets the internal DMA register state which encodes the cause of the interrupt; consequently, it can only be called once per interrupt handler invocation.

parameterdescription.para: Channel whose interrupt is being handled.

simplesect.title: Side Effects:
simplesect.para: Clears channel status flags in dev->regs->ISR.

briefdescription.para: Set the base memory address where data will be read from or written to.

detaileddescription.para: You must not call this function while the channel is enabled.
If the DMA memory size is 16 bits, the address is automatically aligned to a half-word. If the DMA memory size is 32 bits, the address is aligned to a word.

parameterdescription.para: Channel whose base memory address to set.

briefdescription.para: Set the base peripheral address where data will be read from or written to.

detaileddescription.para: You must not call this function while the channel is enabled.
If the DMA peripheral size is 16 bits, the address is automatically aligned to a half-word. If the DMA peripheral size is 32 bits, the address is aligned to a word.

parameterdescription.para: Channel whose peripheral data register base address to set.
Peripheral memory base address to use.

briefdescription.para: Obtain a pointer to an individual DMA channel's registers.

detaileddescription.para: For example, dma_channel_regs(DMA1, DMA_CH1)->CCR is DMA1_BASE->CCR1.

parameterdescription.para: DMA channel whose channel register map to obtain.

briefdescription.para: Check if a DMA channel is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Channel whose enabled bit to check.

briefdescription.para: Get the ISR status bits for a DMA channel.

detaileddescription.para: The bits are returned right-aligned, in the following order: transfer error flag, half-transfer flag, transfer complete flag, global interrupt flag.
If you're attempting to figure out why a DMA interrupt fired; you may find dma_get_irq_cause() more convenient.

parameterdescription.para: Channel whose ISR bits to return.

briefdescription.para: Clear the ISR status bits for a given DMA channel.

detaileddescription.para: If you're attempting to clean up after yourself in a DMA interrupt, you may find dma_get_irq_cause() more convenient.

parameterdescription.para: Channel whose ISR bits to clear.

simplesect.para: Marti Bolivar <mbolivar@leaflabs.com>; Original implementation by Michael Hope
